summary: A court subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to AT&T, commanding the company to appear and produce phone records for a specified number from 1999-2004 for the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which the subpoena is issued to obtain phone records.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the subpoena.

events.title: Subpoena Appearance Date
events.description: AT&T is commanded to appear before the U.S. District Court in New York to testify and produce phone records for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: AT&T Global Legal Demands Center, 11760 U.S. Highway 1, Suite 300, North Palm Beach, FL 33408
United States District Court for the Southern District of New York, 40 Foley Square, Courtroom 318, Borough of Manhattan, New York, NY
keyFacts: The subpoena demands AT&T produce all phone records (subscriber, billing, call detail, toll) for a specific phone number from 1999 to 2004.
The records are sought for use in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
Failure to comply constitutes contempt of court and subjects AT&T to civil sanctions and criminal penalties.
The subpoena indicates an active evidence-gathering phase in the Maxwell prosecution as of November 2021.
